Exaggerate: The claim suggests that Republicans are now "taking credit" for provisions of the health care bill "that they had tried to derail." This implies that Republicans are exaggerating their involvement or support for these provisions.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or examples to support the assertion that Republicans are taking credit for provisions they had tried to derail. It is unclear if there is enough support for this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Republicans are contradicting their previous stance on the health care bill by taking credit for provisions they opposed. However, it does not provide evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why Republicans may be taking credit for provisions of the health care bill. It assumes that they are doing so solely to contradict their previous stance.
